alert.note: Alert for Ventura County Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 23 at 10:36AM PST until February 24 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including the following areas, Central Ventura County Valleys, Lake Casitas, Ojai Valley, Santa Barbara County Interior Mountains, Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast, Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast, Santa Ynez Mountains Eastern Range, Santa Ynez Mountains Western Range, Southeastern Ventura County Valleys, Ventura County Beaches, Ventura County Inland Coast and Ventura County Mountains. * WHEN...From late tonight through Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Rainfall rates up to an inch per hour are possible, especially in the foothills and lower mountain locations. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
